trans-unit.source: Cache purging support for Zope 2 applications
trans-unit.target: Soporte de purga de caché para aplicaciones de Zope 2

trans-unit.source: Cast wait_time to int before calling xrange. This fixes “TypeError: integer argument expected, got float” error. [vincentfretin]
trans-unit.target: Cast wait_time to int before calling xrange. This fixes “TypeError: integer argument expected, got float” error. [vincentfretin]

trans-unit.source: Change the reconnect strategy for the purge thread to retry fewer times and assume a permanent connection failure after one minute and stop the thread. This allows the application process to shutdown cleanly without the purge thread being stuck forever. [hannosch]
trans-unit.target: Cambie la estrategia de reconexión del hilo de purga para volver a intentarlo menos veces y asuma una falla de conexión permanente después de un minuto y detenga el hilo.Esto permite que el proceso de aplicación se cierre limpiamente sin que el hilo de purga se quede atascado para siempre.[hannosch]
Changed i18n_domain to “plone”. [staeff]

trans-unit.source: The caching proxy is “behind” whatever performs the URL rewrite. In this case, the inbound URL (which the proxy may choose to cache, and which may therefore need to be purged) contains the virtual hosting tokens.
trans-unit.target: The caching proxy is “behind” whatever performs the URL rewrite. In this case, the inbound URL (which the proxy may choose to cache, and which may therefore need to be purged) contains the virtual hosting tokens.

trans-unit.source: The caching proxy is “in front of” whatever performs the URL rewrite, or performs the rewrite before passing the request off to the Zope backend. In this case, the inbound URL does not contain the virtual hosting tokens.
trans-unit.target: The caching proxy is “in front of” whatever performs the URL rewrite, or performs the rewrite before passing the request off to the Zope backend. In this case, the inbound URL does not contain the virtual hosting tokens.

trans-unit.source: Use requests library instead of handcrafting connection and requests on our own. This avoids strange problems in real-world customers environments. We do not need to reinvent the wheel here. Requests always uses HTTP 1.1 and drops support for HTTP 1.0 only caches. [jensens]

trans-unit.source: package provides cache purging for Zope 2 applications. It is inspired by (and borrows some code from) Products.CMFSquidTool, but it is not tied to Squid. In fact, it is tested mainly with Varnish, though it should also work with Squid and Enfold Proxy.
trans-unit.target: package provides cache purging for Zope 2 applications. It is inspired by (and borrows some code from) Products.CMFSquidTool, but it is not tied to Squid. In fact, it is tested mainly with Varnish, though it should also work with Squid and Enfold Proxy.
